description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Cascais" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Cascais

places.generalDescription: Sintra-Cascais Natural Park is a stunning protected area that stretches from the lush mountains of Sintra to the beautiful Guincho beach and the dramatic cliffs of Roca cape, which is known as the westernmost point of Europe. This park boasts a diverse range of environments, including forests, sand dunes, lakes, and a rugged coastline with high cliffs and picturesque beaches. It's home to many rare species of flowers and animals.

sources.snippet:
Unusually close to a major city like Lisbon, Sintra-Cascais Natural Park has managed to preserve throughout the territory surrounding the westernmost point of continental Europe and to coexist
 harmoniously nature and human presence, that, so near the capital, would inevitably make itself felt. In its territory, the park presents a stunning diversity of environments and landscapes, including sand dunes, forests, lakes, a rugged coastline where high cliffs are interspersed with lovely
 beaches, the imposing and Cabo da Roca, in the center, the magnificent Serra de Sintra and the entire area classified by UNESCO as a cultural landscape heritage of mankind.
sources.shortName: Tourism in Cascais, Portugal

sources.snippet: Another of the pleasures of living in Cascais is being in contact with nature, like spending your afternoons strolling through the inland Sintra-Cascais Natural Park, one of Portugal's most romantic landscapes that attracts thousands of tourists every year. Closer to the sea, you can visit the great Faro de Roca, the westernmost point on the Portuguese mainland.
sources.shortName: a paradise by the sea, 25 minutes from Lisbon

sources.snippet: Here, you can explore the enchanting outdoors with your special someone. Meander through scenic Sintra romantic walking trails, breathe in the fresh air and let the rugged beauty of the park draw you closer. The rugged cliffs, stunning beaches, and lush forests offer the perfect backdrop for your intimate adventure.
sources.shortName: 15 Most Romantic Places In Sintra

sources.snippet: The trails in and around the Sintra National Park have different degrees of difficulty, so everyone can enjoy this experience.
sources.shortName: Romantic Experience  - Visit Cascais

places.name: Parque Natural de Sintra-Cascais

reviews.text: Beautiful place , but unfortunately packed with tourists. Makes the whole experience of visiting stressful, especially if you go inside the castle, you cannot actually enjoy because people are in a line behind you. Going down we went thru the forest which was not easy, but with unexpected discoveries.

It's pretty cool seeing the outside although today there's construction on and it's definitely not as dramatic as seeing it 5 years ago. But you've come all the way to Sintra. See it. I skipped the interior this time. Not that great.
This was a great experience.  Our tour guide was so knowledgeable about the history.  We enjoyed it so much. It was beautiful ü§©!

places.generalDescription: Quinta da Regaleira is a fascinating early 20th-century palace and garden complex located in Portugal. Originally purchased by the eccentric millionaire Antonio Augusto Carvalho Monteiro, it was designed by Italian architect Luigi Manini, showcasing a blend of Romanesque, Gothic, Renaissance, and Manueline architectural styles. The estate is adorned with hidden symbols related to Templar Knights, Masonry, and the Rose-Cross.

sources.snippet: If you're seeking an enchanting escape with your loved one in Sintra, don't miss Quinta da Regaleira. As you wander through its mysterious tunnels and climb the spiral Initiation Well, you'll uncover secrets and share the thrill of discovery. The romantic aura of hidden grottoes and the mystical vibes make it one of the top Sintra date night spots.
sources.shortName: 15 Most Romantic Places In Sintra
Sintra Village is One Of The Most Romantic Places on Earth

places.name: Quinta da Regaleira

reviews.text:
This is one place in Sintra that you have to visit before anywhere else! I guarantee you won't be disappointed! It was the absolute highlight of our holiday! We absolutely loved this place!
I wouldn't hesitate to go back to this stunning place again and again if I were to return to Portugal. I would call this place ‚ÄúFairytale Land‚Äù it had beautiful architecture everywhere, fairytale towers that you could climb up via spiral staircases, manicured gardens, woodland walks, out of this world initiation wells and an abundance of underground caves! Once you are inside, the place is so vast, you could not possibly get bored. The initiation well was absolutely awesome which led you to the first series of underground caves. It was just one splendour after another. Then when you thought you had seen most things you would stumble upon another underground caves network (without lighting) so the torch on your phone will come in handy! Honestly I think this is one of the loveliest places we have been to. I was excited to be there and the beauty and splendour of this place was simply jaw dropping!
The queue system wasn't so great mind. Definitely book a ticket in advance. Then go to the front of the queue- as there seemed to be two queues- one for the current time slot - then a second queue for later time slots. To get in you have to go to the front queue (which tends to be quite short) . However the second queue will just leave you getting nowhere fast!

Lovely visit in the morning & before the big groups arrive.

We were all very impressed by the well & beautiful gardens.

The palace has amazing woodwork & detail.

Nice cafe to relax for a coffee, cake & recharge.

Another top attraction from Sintra, this place is amazing as well! The gardens are absolutely gorgeous and so relaxing comforting. The view is also breath taking.

I recommend buying tickets in advance because they are very strict with the hours and if you don't come at exactly the time selected on your ticket you may wait a long time to get in. The value for money is very good. I definitely recommend this place!

places.generalDescription: The Moorish Castle, constructed in the 10th century, sits atop a cliff in Sintra and offers breathtaking panoramic views. It played a significant role during the Reconquista and was built during the period of Muslim Iberia. The castle is part of the beautiful Sintra-Cascais Nature Park and is surrounded by other historic sites such as Pena Palace, Quinta da Regaleira, and Convent of the Capuchos.

sources.snippet: When you plan a romantic getaway to Sintra, the Moorish Castle is a place you must see. This historical gem offers you and your partner an opportunity to explore the past while creating unforgettable memories. The best time for a romantic trip to Sintra is undoubtedly enhanced by the sense of adventure and awe you'll feel while taking in the rich history and panoramic vistas of the Moorish Castle.
sources.shortName: 15 Most Romantic Places In Sintra

places.name: The Moorish Castle

reviews.text: Great for a walk. Starting from the train station, we followed the pathway up through the wooded gardens and on to the castle ruins.  Offers great views and a shaded tree lined walk up.  There are several routes to the top, some more paved than others.  But all very scenic.  Worth a visit.

Amazing experience!! Better than the palace in our opinion. You feel like you're on top of the world and it's quite quiet! Lovely walking around, amazing views from every angle!! Can buy tickets there for ‚Ç¨12 per adult. 100% worth it to walk on the castle walls

We visited the place in very hot weather, the humidity was very high, so it was not easy to climb the stairs. Not to mention getting up to the entrance. But the view is definitely worth it, the whole area is visible and there is a nice view of the Pena Palace.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the Sintra Nature Reserve, the Park and Palace of Monserrate is an extravagant 19th-century mansion adorned with Moorish, Gothic, and Indian architectural influences. The Neo-Gothic mansion is surrounded by beautifully landscaped gardens featuring a diverse collection of ferns and captivating follies. Visitors can explore the opulent interiors of the house before strolling through the lush gardens.

sources.snippet: Monserrate Palace is a dreamy escape for couples, offering an enchanting blend of culture and nature. You'll be enchanted by the palace's unique architecture and the lush gardens, which are a delightful treat for your eyes. The romantic atmosphere is perfect for a leisurely exploration, where you can create unforgettable memories together.
sources.shortName: 15 Most Romantic Places In Sintra
Sintra Village is One Of The Most Romantic Places on Earth

places.name: Park and Palace of Monserrate

reviews.text: One of the most beautiful palaces and gardens I ever visited and I am a fan. The carving on the walls inside takes your breath away. The room with 12 muses busts is the most beautifully planned. I am in love with the garden layering and planning, you can see how much work went into making different areas and styles look so organic together. Great place for nature and art lovers. No times slots booking needed. Hop on and hop off buses run until 18:30, park clothes at 19:00. Make sure you can spend 2-3 hours here as the area is huge and the hill on the way back are steep. But it is so much worth your visit, I promise!!

It's a beautiful Palace with a garden. It's the most detailed and impressive one. It's small and less crowded than Pena Palace. I would recommend a visit if you want to avoid the big crowds from Pena Palace and if you are short on time, as you can visit this one in less than 50 minutes. There's a cafeteria there if you want a quick bite.

Parking can be difficult, so be prepared to arrive early.
You can buy tickets on site, no need for advance tickets.

This place is pure magic! The gardens feel like a joyful journey across continents, each one bursting with color and character. The architecture is stunning - graceful, vibrant, and totally awe inspiring. It's one of those spots that lifts your spirits and fills you with wonder. Honestly, it's one of the happiest discoveries I've ever made, an absolute must visit!

places.address: R. Barbosa du Bocage 136, 2710-405 Sintra, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Tamariz Beach is a highly accessible spot, just a short walk from the train station to Lisbon and Cascais. The region boasts 18 beaches, offering plenty of options for beach lovers. During the summer months, Cascais experiences minimal rainfall in July and August with high average temperatures and around 10 hours of sun per day on average.
places.name: Tamariz Beach

reviews.text: The beach in Estoril offers a wonderful experience for visitors. The sand is pleasantly clean, making it ideal for relaxing or a barefoot stroll. There are designated paths for jogging and cycling, which add to the beach's charm, as they provide an active and enjoyable option for visitors. You'll also find water fountains and showers conveniently located, ensuring comfort and refreshment during your visit. The area feels very safe, making it a great destination for families and solo travelers alike. One of the highlights is the chance to observe the various seabirds along the shore-it's a serene and delightful experience. This beach is truly a gem that caters to both relaxation and recreation
Beautiful beach and water, but early june no sunbeds or umbrellas to rent. Some very simple bars/ restaurants. People trying their best, hopefully in the future services will be better

Tons of people on Sunday of August.
Still a nice place to visit and swim! Birds are awaiting u üòÅ

places.generalDescription: The National Palace of Pena, located in Sintra, Portugal, is a 19th-century Romanticist palace situated on a high rock and former monastery site surrounded by parkland. The palace was commissioned by King Ferdinand II as a summer residence for the Portuguese royal family and was designed by Prussian architect Ludwig von Eschwege. It features a mix of architectural styles including Neo-Gothic, Neo-Manueline, Neo-Islamic, and Neo-Renaissance.

sources.snippet: This enchanting palace offers you and your partner a dreamlike setting for your Sintra romantic getaway ideas. With its vibrant colours and intricate architecture, Pena Palace ignites the flames of romance. Wander through the palace's unique interiors, explore the beautiful gardens, and bask in the sweeping views together.
sources.shortName: 15 Most Romantic Places In Sintra
Sintra Village is One Of The Most Romantic Places on Earth

places.name: National Palace of Pena

reviews.text:
Indeed I can admit it's impressive! You feel exactly like in a fairy tale. The castle is huge, beautiful and outstanding! The interior also does not disappoint because the rooms are magical. The staff is highly organized a d helpful.

Please bare in mind to buy tickets in advance and always I mean always arrive at the time you selected when buying the tickets, otherwise you will wait hours because they don't let you go inside any time earlier. They are very strict with the timing. I can't blame them because there are hundreds of people waiting to get inside at any hour.

Overall it was a very nice experience, one of the top 5 from Lisbon and surroundings.

Simply lovely! A wonderful place to take a hike. Loved the vivid colors and the cool architectures. The view from the top of the building is also amazing! Though be careful the wind could be quite strong on the top of the hill, and if you have a fear of height maybe not challenge yourself with the walk outside around the castle (if not, then definitely try it! so cool!). The wait to enter the building is crazy long though, better plan your trip in advance! Definitely cool place!

This was the highlight of our trip- we visited in May on my birthday and it was the perfect outing for someone who enjoys history and the outdoors. There was no queue when we arrived and I would recommend (if you're staying in Lisbon) to get an uber from Lisbon to Palace of Pena and then walk back down because once you've made a trek up then then you have the rest of the park to visit which is quite large! Some beautiful views and very peaceful in some areas, I would love to visit again one day.

places.generalDescription: H√≠fen is a trendy restaurant and bar in Cascais, offering a modern take on Portuguese cuisine. It is popular among both locals and travelers seeking a change of flavor. The restaurant pays close attention to detail, particularly in serving the freshest seafood in unique ways. Their menu features delicious and original dishes designed for sharing, best enjoyed with their amazing cocktails from the bar. While it may be slightly pricey, H√≠fen provides an excellent dining experience with its charming ambiance and high-quality service.

sources.snippet: There are three, with small tables for two and rounded ceilings that make them even more picturesque. The view of Cascais Bay, the outline of the coast to infinity (and beyond) and a menu designed with dishes to be shared help make this the perfect meal for two. And don‚Äôt forget to order one of the house cocktails, either as an aperitif or as a digestif, as you watch the sea and whisper cheesy things to each other.
sources.shortName: 10 romantic restaurants in Cascais

sources.snippet: H√≠fen(we really like this one!) , Ba√≠a do Peixe, Polvo Vadio, Taberna Clandestina Cascais, Dom Diniz, Moules & Gin(Mussels and Gin YUM!), The Tasting Room($$$), McDonald‚Äôs(Haha just jokes), Capricciosa ‚Äì Cascais and many at the Cascais Marina.
sources.shortName: 20 Top Things To Do In Cascais, Portugal

places.name: H√≠fen

reviews.text: Delicious food and great service. We tried the different sangrias they had which were very tasty. We shared the ham croquettes then asked our server to help us pick out some larger plates. She suggested cod a la bras which is a traditional Portuguese dish and her comfort food, and it did not disappoint! The pork secretos was also 10/10. We also tried the duck escabeche which is a cold dish served with pickled red cabbage and mandarin which was also tasty but not as good as the other too! We were celebrating a birthday and they brought out a spoonful of really nice chocolate mousse with a candle in it which was a lovely touch! The whole dinner only came to ‚Ç¨69 so incredible value. Would highly recommend to anyone

The food was absolutely exceptional every bite was bursting with flavour and clearly made with care. The drinks were just as impressive. They were delicious, refreshing, and perfectly crafted. We enjoyed it all while taking in a stunning view of the beach, which made the experience even more special. The vibe was relaxed yet vibrant, creating the perfect atmosphere to unwind. To top it all off, our server was friendly, attentive, and genuinely welcoming. Highly recommend if you're in Cascais!

This is a tapas style restaurant with a lot of good options. My partner and I split 3 dishes and it was the perfect portion. I also got a non-acoholic beverage that was delicious. Service was quick and very polite and personable. Great views of the marina and of Cascais area.

places.address: Av. Dom Carlos I 48, 2750-310 Cascais, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Located at an impressive 488 meters above sea level, the Sanctuary of Peninha is a Baroque chapel and early-1900s palace situated on a rugged outcrop. From this vantage point, visitors can enjoy sweeping views of the Atlantic coast and the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park. Originally a shrine for Christian pilgrims seeking fertility, it was later expanded into a summer residence before being acquired by the Moon Company. Plans are underway to restore its historical significance and former beauty.

sources.snippet: Tucked away in the enchanting hills of Sintra, Peninha Sanctuary beckons to you with its awe-inspiring mountaintop views and the whispering secrets of the winds. This secluded gem, steeped in history and surrounded by a tapestry of green, is the perfect backdrop for an intimate escape, where you can lose yourselves in each other's company amidst nature's timeless embrace. Location: Sintra, Portugal.Best Things to Do:
sources.shortName: 15 Most Romantic Places In Sintra

places.name: Sanctuary of Peninha

reviews.text:
Haven't been there for a while and it really surprised me! Beautiful scenery (specially going uphill from Malveira da Serra and a lot to explore on the top of the hill from the old monastery to many walks.
Found out that semi wild horses and cows were introduced there in 2022. Was very nice to see them and explore around even with the fast changing weather.

Portugal offers lots of opportunities to be close to nature. This time, we decided to explore Sintra with company called Greentrekker for a Sunday walk in the nature reserve. We saw enchanted forest with big stone formations, best views of the valley and ocean, and even visited centuries old woman monastery. Our guide was amazing, passionate about nature, environment and I really loved it. We saw lots of people doing trail running and cycling. Amazing place
Best view in Sintra. Worth visiting

places.generalDescription: Praia do Guincho is a renowned beach that has gained fame for being a prime spot for surfing, windsurfing, and kite surfing. It also holds significance as a filming location for a James Bond movie. The surrounding area of Guincho offers an array of excellent dining options, including the prestigious Michelin-starred Fortaleza do Guincho. Additionally, the region in central Portugal boasts various wine regions such as Bucelas, Carcavelos, and Colares.

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs windy but beautiful and perfect for surfing and windsurfing (which is why it has hosted international championships). It‚Äôs also the biggest beach in Cascais, and its location about 6km (4 miles) from the center of town, in the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park, means it‚Äôs never crowded. It remains a wild beach, with dunes of powdery sand and surrounded by Mediterranean vegetation, and was a backdrop for an opening scene in a James Bond movie ("On Her Majesty‚Äôs Secret Service‚Äù).
sources.shortName: Top 10 Cascais Must-See Attractions and Things to Do

sources.snippet: The largest and most beautiful beach in Cascais preserves a wild, well-protected landscape. Backed by large dunes and the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park, it‚Äôs windy but one of the best in Portugal for water sports, particularly surfing and windsurfing. Due to its rather remote location in the 1940s, it was a popular escape for international celebrities like Walt Disney, Evita Per√≥n, and Grace Kelly.
sources.shortName: CASCAIS BEACHES - Best Beach Guide 2024

sources.snippet: Praia do Guincho is a vast sandy beach that is exposed to strong prevailing winds and the huge waves of the Atlantic, making it ideal for surfing and kite surfing. Guincho beach is surrounded by the dramatic and unspoilt natural scenery of the Serra da Sintra, with its wind-swept hills and lush forests. There is an 8km cycle path that connects Cascais to the Praia do Guincho.
sources.shortName: Cascais; the best sights, attractions and things to see and do in 2025

sources.snippet: Come and visit one of the biggest beaches in the country, Praia do Guincho is part of the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park. Embraced by the recently recovered Dunes, Praia Grande do Guincho is visited by national and international holidaymakers and is also sought by practitioners of Surf, Windsurf and Kitesurf.
sources.shortName: Sintra and Cascais | Tourismforall

sources.snippet: Starting with the furthest spot in Cascais (if you‚Äôre coming from the town train station) and the most beautiful one to me. A wooden boardwalk through the dunes and fine grass leads to the deep blues of the Atlantic. Often wild and windy, but that is part of the charm of the raw beauty of this coastline.
sources.siteName: S O N I A   D A V I E S
sources.shortName: Photographer‚Äôs Travel Guide to Cascais, Portugal ‚Äî S O N I A D A V I E S

sources.snippet: The best-known beaches are Praia Do Guincho, Praia da Duquesa and Praia Dos Pescadores and they say that the waters around there have healing powers...
sources.shortName: a paradise by the sea, 25 minutes from Lisbon
12 CHARMING Things to Do in CASCAIS, Portugal (Helpful Guide)

places.name: Praia do Guincho

reviews.text: Had an accidental encounter with a local dude that showed me this place after the bus couldn't drive to Cabo Raso because it was devastated by the storm. Was a real pleasure to meet him and a cool thing that just by that I came across this scenic beach.

This beach is absolutely stunning! It's so big and wide that you feel amazed. The water is very cold, at least for us because we couldn't swim in it. Also there are big waves so it's not a friendly beach because it's a little dangerous to swim here, but it's perfect for people doing water sports which are all over the place! I strongly recommend this wild beach experience!

It's spacious like a desert! So even you go in the summer time it's still not packed and you can easily find a quiet space for yourself

The water isn't too cold but very wavy. So it's good for surfing

Easy to access by the bus from Cascais

places.generalDescription: Praia Nossa Senhora da Conceicao, located in Cascais, is a popular and centrally located beach known for its bustling atmosphere. It is ideal for sunbathing, paddleboarding in calm waters, and enjoying drinks at seaside bars. The beach offers various amenities such as lifeguards, bathrooms, showers, rentals, and a bar/restaurant. Its tranquil waters make it suitable for swimming and it is well-equipped to cater to families with children.

sources.snippet:
The most central beach in Cascais is, naturally, the most crowded, but it‚Äôs perfect for sunbathing, to paddleboard on calm waters and to enjoy drinks at bars with sea views. It‚Äôs found between two iconic mansions, the starting point of the Cascais-Estoril promenade, and the closest beach to the train station in Cascais. Beach for: Swimming, Paddling, Walks by the sea
 Lifeguards: Yes
 Bathrooms: Yes
 Showers: Yes
 Rentals: Yes
 Bar or Restaurant: Yes
 Accessible: Yes 
 Parking: Nearby
 Transportation: Train from Lisbon
sources.shortName: CASCAIS BEACHES - Best Beach Guide 2024

sources.snippet: The main reason most people head to Cascais is for a day at the beach. Praia da Concei√ß√£o is the one closest to the train station and also one of the best beaches on the Lisbon coast for some sunbathing and to get your feet wet. Overlooked by mansions, it‚Äôs the starting point of an oceanfront promenade that goes past several other beaches all the way to Estoril.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Cascais Must-See Attractions and Things to Do
20 Top Things To Do In Cascais, Portugal

places.name: Praia Nossa Senhora da Conceicao

reviews.text: A nice beach to sit and relax.  It is only a few minutes walk from the train station.  When I was there in June, the water was freezing, so I did not get to go in, but the water looked gorgeous and must be really nice in the late summer months.  There's plenty of nearby shop and restaurants accessible nearby.
Beautiful beach for sunbathing but it is not ideal for swimming bcz the water is so cold even in the summer. Feel free here to find the place for you.

Beautiful beaches with fine golden sand and clear clean water. Being sunny Sunday afternoon the beaches were crowded but peaceful unlike some of the beaches in other location. There are a lot of shops and restaurants nearby for food and refreshments after a pleasant walk by the water.

places.generalDescription: Skatepark Parque das Gera√ß√µes, also known as PDG skatepark, is a popular destination for adrenaline seekers and families alike. It has become increasingly attractive to girls interested in skateboarding, welcoming both experienced athletes and newcomers to the sport. Inaugurated in 2013 by the Municipality of Cascais, this skatepark boasts impressive features such as a great snake run and a well-designed street section.

sources.snippet: The name is Parque das GeracÃßoÃÉes (‚ÄúGenerations Park‚Äù), and it really means it, since the park is always full of people of all ages. It opened in 2013, after winning a vote in the local participatory budget, a process in which residents propose and vote on new community projects. The park has around 10,000 square meters of ramps and curved surfaces, perfect for skating, biking and other extreme sports.
sources.shortName: 30 reasons why you will definitely fall in love with Cascais

places.name: Skatepark Parque das Gera√ß√µes

reviews.text: One of the best skateparks in Portugal, if not the very best. With top-notch facilities and a great vibe, it's a must-visit for skaters of all levels

Over the Top.!!!

Good Job Guys.!!

One of the coolest places for kids & adults. Great ramps and open space, beautiful views of the ocean and an overall chill vibe. They have a small outdoor cafe with decent food options, not super healthy and not terrible. There are no bathrooms. There is a supermarket (Pingo Doce) 5 mins away.

places.generalDescription: Praia da Rainha, also known as Queens Beach, is a charming and intimate cove located in Cascais. Despite being one of the smallest beaches in the area, it boasts stunning golden sands surrounded by striking rock formations that overlook the Bay of Cascais. Its historical significance dates back to 1889 when it was a private retreat for Queen Amelia.

sources.snippet: Its name (‚ÄúQueen‚Äôs Beach‚Äù) recalls the time when it was the private beach of Queen Am√©lia in the 1880s, but it‚Äôs now accessible to everyone. It‚Äôs small but the perfect Instagram beach, hidden between rocks and cliffs, right in the pedestrianized center of town. The calm, crystal-clear waters attract families with children, young couples, standup paddleboarders, and teenagers who love to jump off the rocks.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Cascais Must-See Attractions and Things to Do

sources.snippet: This small postcard beach is hidden next to Praia da Concei√ß√£o, behind the mansion that‚Äôs now the Albatroz Hotel (see below). Its shallow waters are safe for children, while teenagers prefer to jump from the rocks on the western end. Its name (‚ÄúQueen‚Äôs Beach‚Äù) is a tribute to Queen Am√©lia, who used to spend the sunnier days here in the 1880s.
sources.shortName: CASCAIS BEACHES - Best Beach Guide 2024

sources.snippet: Praia da Rainha, or Queens Beach, is a beautiful small beach in the old town, only accessible by foot through the many scenic alleys. If you are at Miradouro Fernandes, continue walking east through the buildings. Before you access the beach, you will discover another little viewpoint next to Praia da Rainha.
sources.siteName: S O N I A   D A V I E S
sources.shortName: Photographer‚Äôs Travel Guide to Cascais, Portugal ‚Äî S O N I A D A V I E S

sources.snippet: The Praia da Rainha is a small but picturesque beach right in the centre of Cascais. The beach is so pretty that in 1889 it was chosen by Queen Am√©lia as her private beach, and has been known as the Praia da Rainha (Queen's Beach) ever since. The pretty Praia da Rainha, as chosen by a queen...
sources.shortName: Cascais; the best sights, attractions and things to see and do in 2025

sources.snippet: Portugal‚Äôs iconic rugged coastline is known the world over, so why not experience the splendor for yourself?. Cascais itself has no shortage of spectacular beaches to choose from, but one of my favorites is Praia da Rainha.
sources.shortName: 12 CHARMING Things to Do in CASCAIS, Portugal (Helpful Guide)

places.name: Praia da Rainha

reviews.text:
This beach was a very nice choice. Even if the beach is tiny and there were a lot of people, we still did some space for us. They have free bathrooms where you can also change to your swimming suit which is a big plus. It's a sandy beach so don't worry for rocks or anything else because you don't need beach shoes. The water was a little cold but little by little we managed in the end to get in and it was amazing. You will fond very nice tiny golfs where you can swim between the rocks.

I strongly recommend this beach!

The closest beach to the Cascais train station like 5 minutes on foot. It is quite crowded but i could always find a spot. I was hesitant to go far to the next beach but this is cleaner than the others so staying here was the great choice!

This is a beautiful beach with a lot of character! We loved how it was nestled in a cove-like area, with the rock formations surrounding you, plus it is right beside all of the beautiful, old streets - you only need to walk down some steps and you're on the beach. We'll definitely come back here!

WARNING: When swimming, be mindful of the rocks in the water! Double-check before diving in.

Only con: The water didn't seem the cleanest. There was heaps of random bits in it - I can't fully describe what all the stuff was. We still had a great time swimming, but it did feel a tad gross with different things floating about.

However, we'd happily visit again! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

ALSO! We HIGHLY recommend buying a pina colada from this stall on the street, before you go down the steps to the beach. You're served a whole pineapple with the tastiest pina colada freshly made in the pineapple. Once you have purchased a pineapple you can go back for refills for ‚Ç¨5 per pineapple drink. It was soo nice having this on the beach ü§åüèº

places.generalDescription: Taberna Clandestina Cascais is a vibrant tavern with a noticeable terrace and a window facing Rua Amarela, offering meat boards, focaccia-bread sandwiches, pastas, and cocktails. During the day, it serves petiscos like cheese and charcuterie boards before transforming into a bar at night. Situated on the lively Yellow Street in Cascais, this spot offers a relaxed atmosphere for enjoying Portuguese wines and Italian ingredients.

sources.snippet: H√≠fen(we really like this one!) , Ba√≠a do Peixe, Polvo Vadio, Taberna Clandestina Cascais, Dom Diniz, Moules & Gin(Mussels and Gin YUM!), The Tasting Room($$$), McDonald‚Äôs(Haha just jokes), Capricciosa ‚Äì Cascais and many at the Cascais Marina.
sources.shortName: 20 Top Things To Do In Cascais, Portugal

places.name: Taberna Clandestina Cascais

reviews.text: We had the most delightful meal here. It is busy but the staff handled it with ease and everything from the cocktails to the amazing array of dishes was absolutely on point. Loved the staff and the atmosphere, would highly recommend!

Fantastic. Service is a little slow when it's busy, and the kids option is pasta only. But these are two, minor notes. The food is fantastic- varied, fairly priced, well portioned and full of flavour. The octopus was absolutely stellar, as was the tortellini ragu and the braised beef cheeks. Drinks were similarly quality. The staff spoke excellent English. A really easy, wonderful slow lunch.

Great place, found it thanks to the great reviews. Decided to walk here instead of eating on the long stretch of touristy restaurants. Totally worth the hype. The food was amazing, everything was fresh and I could tell they were made with love.

Very nice staff, when the lemonade was too sour the bartender fixed it and filled it to the top. He was understanding and although busy, took the time to help us.

The burrata was very tasty, as well as the carbonara.

The food was awesome! I'd definitely come back!

places.generalDescription: Aires Estoril is a culinary gem that transports you straight to Argentina while nestled in the charming surroundings of Monte Estoril. This sophisticated restaurant offers an exquisite dining experience, showcasing traditional Argentinian cuts of meat and a selection of local wines. Guests can indulge in regional specialties that are hard to find elsewhere, from mouthwatering empanadas to decadent desserts featuring dulce de leche. The ambiance is warm and inviting, making it perfect for a romantic dinner or a special night out.

sources.snippet: Sophisticated and with attentive service, Aires offers an elegant and immersive journey to Argentina without leaving Monte Estoril. It features the traditional (and highly acclaimed) Argentinian cuts of meat, as well as local wines, but also serves regional specialities that are rarely found elsewhere. From empanadas to desserts with dulce de leche, it promises a delightful dinner for two.
sources.shortName: 10 romantic restaurants in Cascais

places.name: Aires Estoril

reviews.text:
It's a must while visiting Portugal, big portions, tasty food and excellent drinks. It felt like we were fully immersed in a true Argentine experience. The waiters, the service, even the tableware everything was on point and more.

We had empanadas, milanesa, and a lomo with fries and mashed potatoes. Everything was insanely good. Before the meal, they brought us a typical table service with classic Argentine sauces. Honestly, a great touch and super tasty.

If you're visiting Portugal, this place is an absolute must. Authentic vibes and amazing food.

Incredible food, friendly staff, beautiful space!
We had our rehearsal lunch the day before our wedding at Aires and it could not have been more perfect. We found them online, and despite never visiting in person, the team responded quickly and made the planning so easy. We had a 4 course meal for 25 guests and every bite was delicious. We had steaks, several family style sides, a summer salad, and desserts and I would recommend all of it! The steaks were so good but very large, definitely enough for two. We also had empanadas and sausage for starters and our guests loved them! The restaurant looks exactly as it does in the photos which was helpful for planning from a distance. If we were local, we would absolutely be regular customers.
Great Argentinian meat! You will not be disappointed ordering Argentinian chorizo, very succulent meat. They also have great empanadas. It is a bit pricey but you are eating amazing beef.

places.generalDescription: Monument perched high in the hills, offering views of Palacio de Pena & surrounding gardens.

sources.shortName: Sintra Village is One Of The Most Romantic Places on Earth

places.name: High Cross

reviews.text:
The experience was incredibly tranquil, with far fewer visitors compared to the bustling Pena Palace, making it feel like a hidden retreat. The trek itself was delightful, winding through towering trees adorned with lichens that added a touch of timeless beauty. The crisp, fresh air invigorated every step, and the soothing sounds of small waterfalls cascading down the rocks created a serene soundtrack to the journey.

As you ascend, the lush greenery envelopes you, offering pockets of shade and moments to pause and appreciate nature's magnificence. Reaching the top feels like a reward, with sweeping, panoramic views of the entire city sprawling beneath you. The journey is as enriching as the destination, a perfect escape into nature's embrace.

(2025/4/17) FYI there is zero view of the Palace at the moment. Completely c'blocked by trees. The view of other shiz is nice but don't come here expecting those postcard pix like I did lol. Couldn't find ‚ÄúTea Hill‚Äù either so best distance view of the palace I got was from the Moorish Castle which was pretty solid.
Cruz Alta was nice, but we really wanted a full view of Pena Palace from afar. Too bad, though, because we hiked so far and hardly saw anything, tons of trees blocked the view.

places.generalDescription: Furnas do Guincho is a top choice seafood restaurant located in Cascais, Portugal, known for its perfect outdoor lunch spot right on the ocean rocks. The restaurant offers a variety of delicious dishes such as lobster crepes and flambe fish. It's customary to witness fantastic displays like the flambe fish emerging from the kitchen every day. The restaurant also offers other delectable options including lobster acorda, octopus cataplana, and assorted seafood.

sources.snippet: The secret is to study the sun‚Äôs movements and get to the restaurant early before the sun sets and turns the sea golden (awww!). Of course, the restaurant also has its charms at night, but those tables above the rocks and the sea, where boats once fished for lobster, are more charming when there is still some natural light. The trick is to book tables near the windows or, on hot days, a table on the terrace.
sources.shortName: 10 romantic restaurants in Cascais

places.name: Furnas do Guincho

reviews.text:
Nestled along the stunning shoreline of Cascais, Furnas Do Guincho offers more than just a meal-it delivers a culinary journey paired with exceptional service. From the moment we arrived, we felt warmly welcomed, thanks to the attentive and kind staff, including Ricardo, Bruno, and Antonio, who made us feel at home throughout the evening.

To start, we were treated to some delightful house specialties that set the tone for the meal. The fresh prawns, briny olives, and rich Portuguese cheese (akin to cottage cheese but far superior) were accompanied by a basket of mixed bread and another variety of Portuguese cheese. Each bite was a celebration of freshness and local flavour, perfectly complementing the beautiful seaside ambiance.

Their bar menu impressed with its selection of Portuguese beers and creative cocktails, offering great options to pair with the meal. The main courses, however, were the true stars. Standout dishes included the shellfish curry, squid and prawns on a spit, and noodles with grouper and shrimps-each presented with flair and bursting with unique flavors. Every dish was thoughtfully prepared, showcasing fresh ingredients and impeccable culinary artistry.

A particularly charming touch to the experience was the personal dishing out of the meals at the table. This added a layer of intimacy and attentiveness, making us feel truly cared for.

Desserts at Furnas Do Guincho are not to be overlooked! The mango mousse, almond tart, and cheesecake were all delightful finales to a perfect meal, each one indulgent and exquisitely crafted.

From start to finish, the service was outstanding, and the staff's warmth truly elevated the dining experience. Furnas Do Guincho is a gem in Cascais, combining breathtaking views, stellar food, and exemplary hospitality into one unforgettable evening. Highly recommended for anyone visiting this beautiful coastal town!

Furnas do Guincho ‚Äì oceanfront seafood with soul.
‚Ä¢	üêü Salt-crusted seabass was melt-in-your-mouth good.
‚Ä¢	ü¶Ä Crab dip in the shell + fresh oysters on ice = unbeatable start.
‚Ä¢	üåä Outdoor seating right by the crashing waves-drama in the best way.
‚Ä¢	üç∑ Relaxed service, retro glassware, and a local crowd. No flash, just class.
‚Ä¢	üìù Honest menu with old-school charm. Unpretentious, unforgettable.

Wonderful Sunday lunch with great seafood and wine. Great selection of fresh seafood beautifully cooked.  Very attentive waiters.  Good atmosphere and stunning views of the sea! Reserve a table on advance. Totally recommend this restaurant!

places.generalDescription: Quinta do Pis√£o is a nature preserve located in the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park, offering a variety of activities for visitors. The area features hiking trails with wooden platforms to facilitate access and minimize natural slopes. Families can enjoy donkey rides, encounter horses, sheep, and other wild animals, pick their own food from vegetable fields, and explore the flora on walks or bike rides.

sources.snippet: The Onyria Quinta da Marinha Golf, in Cascais, has 18 Holes with 5870 meters of pure nature and great challenges. Designed by the legendary Robert Trent Jones, you will find, during the course, breathtaking views of the Atlantic Ocean and Serra de Sintra.
sources.shortName: Romantic Experience  - Visit Cascais

places.name: Quinta do Pis√£o

reviews.text:
A magical place. Modern visitor centre with nice and helpful staff.
We did the easy 4km walk around the farm on a cloudy/rainy day and it was lovely.
The parts we enjoyed most were the stable with horse and donkeys, the large vegetables garden and the farm animals in the wide open spaces.
The landscapes are beautiful!

Well managed outdoor complex with a nice (and easy) walking trail. Recommended for a slow walk or easy bike ride. Some animals can be spotted through the trail, though not as many as there used to be, so it seems. Map and directions are found throughout the trail. Easy to access with any car, plus it has a huge & free parking space. The trail starts and ends at the same place & it took us about an 1.5-2hrs with some stops.
There are some easy trails to walk around, so going further to avoid the crowds and there are some tables and chairs that you can have lunch in the nature, very chilled

places.generalDescription: Praia da Duquesa, along with Praia da Conceicao, forms the main beach of Cascais. It is larger than Praia do Tamariz and offers a variety of activities such as boat rides, sea inflatables, pedalos, and beach sports. The beach is conveniently located just a 5-minute walk from the train station. With its golden sands and calm waters, it's an ideal spot for families.

sources.snippet: The beautiful Praia da Duquesa and Praia da Concei√ß√£o are two linked beaches that form the largest sandy stretch in Cascais, offering a fantastic setting for a beach day. This beach boasts golden sands, calm sea waters and a myriad of activities (kayaks, inflatables) along with a wide selection of beach bars and cafes. The calm and clean sea waters are perfect for families.
sources.shortName: Cascais; the best sights, attractions and things to see and do in 2025

sources.snippet: The mansion on the eastern end of Praia da Concei√ß√£o marks the beginning of this similar beach. It‚Äôs named after the Duchess of Palmela, who lived in the other large mansion, on its eastern side. It has crystal-clear water, boat and parasol rentals, and can get packed in the summer.
sources.shortName: CASCAIS BEACHES - Best Beach Guide 2024

sources.snippet: The best-known beaches are Praia Do Guincho, Praia da Duquesa and Praia Dos Pescadores and they say that the waters around there have healing powers...
sources.shortName: a paradise by the sea, 25 minutes from Lisbon

places.name: Praia da Duquesa

reviews.text: Beautiful beach in Porto. Water was cold end of August but plenty of people were still swimming. Water sport opportunities available.
I went in April and it was nice and warm but beware the sea is a little dirty. Nothing I can't handle though! Very busy spring break but it was fun and everyone was loving it!!

Nice beach to spend a few hours, the sand is nice and clean and the water is a bit warmer than other places, it's not clear though. The worst thing about the beach was how hot the sand was when walking off and on the boardwalks, you must wear sandals or burn your feet like I did!

places.generalDescription: Lambrettazzurra Pizzeria is a Neapolitan pizzeria located in Cascais, known for its move to a larger restaurant in mid-2017. The restaurant is the brainchild of a Brazilian couple who have lived in Portugal for 25 years and offers pizzas with thick edges and moist centers. The owner, Humberto, changed his life to study Italy extensively and source suppliers from Naples to create an authentic Italian experience.

sources.snippet: Who says romance only aligns with sophisticated food, luxury service, dim lights, and three-digit bills?. Sometimes, all a relationship needs is an honest, welcoming, and comfortable place with friendly service and top-quality ingredients. Lambrettazzurra offers all this, along with the best Neapolitan pizzas in town, perfectly complemented by fine red wine or draft Italian beer.
sources.shortName: 10 romantic restaurants in Cascais

places.name: Lambrettazzurra Pizzeria

reviews.text:
Locals told us this Pizza place was the best in town. They were not wrong.
We went multiple times on our trip to Cascais because we couldn't get enough of it.
They import their ingredients in from Italy and the owner/pizza maker spent years in Italy perfecting his culinary art.
You will not be disappointed.

We loved the prosciutto Danielle and the pepperoni calzone.
Excellent pizza, although quite expensive. Margarita is ‚Ç¨14, others up to ‚Ç¨20. Still, very enjoyable.

Excellent food and service ‚ú® I'll repeat and recommend.

The space is tight and tables are a little too close together in my opinion.
Other than that we had a fantastic dinner.

places.address: Tv. Visc. da Luz 3, 2750-413 Cascais, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Moules & Gin is a unique and romantic restaurant that offers a peculiar dining experience. The menu mainly features mussels prepared in various ways, adding to the romantic ambiance of the place. The other half of its name, 'Gin,' represents the wide selection of gin labels served in balloon glasses. This restaurant stands out from others by offering fresh seafood served in a fun street-food style along with a variety of delicious cocktails.

sources.snippet: The romantic nature of this restaurant begins with the accent used in the choice of main course: moules et frites (mussels and chips, but remember to order in French, thank you very much), and then the menu itself, which is mostly mussels served in different ways ‚Äì and we‚Äôre not quite sure why, but there‚Äôs something romantic about shellfish. And then the drink that gives the restaurant the other half of its name: gin. There are many different labels to choose from, all served in balloon glasses.
sources.shortName: 10 romantic restaurants in Cascais

sources.snippet: H√≠fen(we really like this one!) , Ba√≠a do Peixe, Polvo Vadio, Taberna Clandestina Cascais, Dom Diniz, Moules & Gin(Mussels and Gin YUM!), The Tasting Room($$$), McDonald‚Äôs(Haha just jokes), Capricciosa ‚Äì Cascais and many at the Cascais Marina.
sources.shortName: 20 Top Things To Do In Cascais, Portugal

sources.snippet: Moules & Gin: In this fashionable Portuguese restaurant, the mussels are prepared in a novel way ‚Äì they leave behind their usual garnish of beer and are instead served with the finest Gin & Tonic in Cascais.
sources.shortName: a paradise by the sea, 25 minutes from Lisbon

places.name: Moules & Gin

reviews.text: We went as a group of four and all enjoyed our meals. We had the mussels with pesto, mussels with Belgian sauce, mussels with tomato sauce and fresh herbs and the sliced steak with mustard, butter and fresh herbs. Each of us were pleased with our dish. The pesto was our favorite though. The blue gin was fun and tasty, as was the Thursday gin with lemon and bay leaves. The staff was attentive and friendly and spoke fantastic English!

Perfection! The host was excellent, very friendly. All food was 5 stars. We shared a steak and mussels between us. Mussels were obviously great, wide range of varieties with broths. Steam was excellent and the chips perfect too. Gin very tasty. Portions were very generous. Can't fault it. Try it!

Had a fun lunch here. Tried the Salmon ceviche which was excellent. The deep fried mussels were good but just a minute overcooked I thought. We had three types of mussels which were good. Large servings. The only suggestion I might have is that the sauce was a lot in volume. When you finished half the pleasure is in consuming the infused mussel broth. Less water more cream Prehaps. The staff are welcoming and friendly. Might do with an electronic system to keep track of drinks etc. Our drinks were missed 3x. It did not take away from the meal but if you're going to charge top prices for Gins etc finish the order. I do prefer chilled beer glasses. A small point but if you trying for the upper end. Bread was excellent ask for it heated. I would go back.

places.address: R. Nova da Alfarrobeira 14, 2750-452 Cascais, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Hotel Albatroz Cascais is a charming beachside boutique hotel located on Conceicao beach, known for its elegant rooms and suites. Originally a 1960s inn with just ten rooms, it has now expanded to offer luxurious accommodations decorated in soothing shades of green, blue, and beige. The hotel's cliffside setting provides stunning views of the ocean, and guests can enjoy fine dining at the Albatroz restaurant while taking in the sunset from the bar/lounge area.

sources.snippet: The Albatroz is a historic manor residence that once belonged to a Portuguese duke and duchess, before it was converted into a five-star boutique hotel. Perched on top of rocks, it is steps from one of Cascais‚Äô beautiful beaches. The hotel has three beautifully decorated room styles, specially designed tours to some fascinating Portuguese landmarks and leisure activities such as cooking classes with the hotel chef, wine tastings and rides aboard the Albatroz Yacht.
sources.shortName: The Best Hotels In Cascais, Portugal, For Every Traveller

sources.snippet: The luxurious Albatroz Hotel in Cascais offers modern comfort, a saltwater pool, and a wonderful view of the bay. Formerly a royal summer residence, it blends historic charm with contemporary luxury. The nearest beach in Cascais is just a one-minute walk away.
sources.shortName: Handpicked boutique hotels Cascais luxury hotels and holiday homes.

sources.snippet: This romantic hotel occupies the mansion that stands between Praia da Concei√ß√£o and Praia da Rainha. It offers scenic views from just about anywhere, including most of the rooms, the restaurant and the terrace with swimming pool. More Details and Prices
sources.shortName: CASCAIS BEACHES - Best Beach Guide 2024

sources.snippet: Beautifully decorated rooms and suites in pastels with sea views, private balconies, and marble bathrooms. Excellent pool and restaurant, and access to the beach. Perfect for an active beach holiday for families or couples.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Cascais, Portugal (2025)

places.name: Hotel Albatroz Cascais

reviews.text: Amazing hotel!! Service was 5 stars. Room was nice and spacious and the pool area is amazing. Great bar and restaurants. Delicious breakfast included. We loved our stay here. Can look out on the ocean and beach while laying at the pool. Location is centrally located and you can easily walk to cascais restaurants

My husband and I recently had our welcome party for our wedding at the Hotel Albatroz. We are so happy we did; it truly was as big of a highlight as the wedding itself. First, the hotel's location on the beach is stunning. The Dom Carlos room has enormous windows that provided our guests the most wonderful, beautiful view. We worked with Marta, who we cannot recommend highly enough. She worked incredibly diligently to ensure every detail of our event went smoothly. She helped us coordinate rental furniture and flower arrangement delivery. She was professional, responsive to emails, and genuine. We felt very supported and heard by her and her team.

The welcome party was perfect. We cannot say enough amazing things about the FOOD. Everyone loved it. Nobody was bored. The bartenders were professional and quick to make sure people had a drink. We were able to choose several signature cocktails which our guests loved. If you are getting married in or around Cascais we highly recommend the Hotel Albatroz as a potential rehearsal dinner / welcome party space!!

Overall, it was a really good stay. The hotel has a lot of charm, and the interior decoration is tasteful, elegant, and clearly looked after. The location is perfect. You're right on the water with easy access to the center of Cascais. The restaurant is exceptional. Easily one of the best meals I've had in the area. Service was excellent throughout, very attentive without being overbearing.

A couple of things could be better. The corridors aren't well soundproofed. You can hear people talking like they're standing inside your room, at least on the floor we were on. Also, the water in the bathrooms gets way too hot, to the point of being uncomfortable.

Still, it's a solid hotel. I'd come back, but I'd book a quieter room.  The one we booked was one of the last available on Expedia.

places.generalDescription: KAPPO is a high-end Japanese cuisine restaurant in Cascais, known for its romantic ambiance and surprising dishes. The low red-toned lighting and discreet service create a special dining experience, especially when enjoying the omakase menu. This chef's choice menu offers a variety of tastings featuring locally sourced fish from Portugal, with the exception of tuna from Spain.

sources.snippet: With its low red-toned lighting, discreet service, surprising dishes, and the counter ‚Äì oh, the romance of eating side by side instead of face to face ‚Äì Kappo is one of the most special places in Cascais. In Tiago Pen√£o's high-end Japanese cuisine restaurant, it's best to enjoy the romantic ambiance without worrying about what to order: go for the omakase menu (‚Ç¨110) and see that you're in good hands.
sources.shortName: 10 romantic restaurants in Cascais

places.name: KAPPO | Japanese Cuisine

reviews.text:
Probably the best experience I had this year. The quality of the Food is well highlighted and paired with the best wine, most of the time local.

It is a full experience, Trust me, a worthwile one.

The best omakaze & sushi experience i've had in Portugal, and to be honest top 3 ever.
Everything was absolutely delicious.
We loved the mix of warm proper dishes, with the lighter sashimi & nigiris.
Recommend adding the temaki & wagyu add ons.
Well done guys, was really really impressed.

What a great place! We celebrated our wedding anniversary here and it was just amazing! The food was so fresh, so tasty and amazing every time! The service was great and friendly. We enjoyed this experience very much and want to thank the whole team for all the hard work they put into this place!

places.address: Av. Em√≠dio Navarro 23 A, 2750-337 Cascais, Portugal

places.generalDescription: E-Foil Cascais is an exhilarating water activity that offers a unique experience for both beginners and experienced riders. The sessions are led by knowledgeable and supportive instructors who ensure that participants feel comfortable and confident on the water. Whether you're new to foiling or looking to improve your skills, the personalized guidance provided by instructors like Eduardo and Pedro guarantees a memorable and enjoyable time.

sources.snippet: If you want to treat yourself to a combination of sea view, infinity pool, spa, a selection of restaurants and spacious rooms in Cascais the Hotel Miragem is the right place for you. You can choose from a range of room categories ‚Äì all of them include a rich breakfast buffet. Altogether the Hotel Miragem offers everything needed for an unforgettable stay ‚Äì a perfect gift for a romantic getaway!
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to do in Cascais, Portugal

places.name: E-Foil Cascais

reviews.text: I booked a two hour wing-foil session and had the absolute best time out on the water. Eduardo was an outstanding instructor. He gave me great feedback and tips on my gybes and I made real progress in our time together. He also made sure all of the gear and equipment was properly sized for me, my skill level and the  conditions that day. It was so thoughtful and really enabled me to get the most out of our time together. I cannot say enough about how excellent Eduardo and the shop overall was!!!

Big thanks to Andr√© and the team for an awesome efoil session! They made it easy, fun, and safe-even for beginners like us. Definitely a must-do if you're in Cascais and want to try something different on the water.
Absolutely amazing experience! Great equipment and even better teachers! Andrea got me flying in 10 minutes!!!! Recommend to everyone to try it out and fly around this beach. ü§©

places.address: R. Frederico Arouca 175 III, 2750-427 Cascais, Portugal

places.generalDescription: The Oitavos is a luxurious hotel nestled within the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park, offering a blend of modern design and untouched natural surroundings. The property boasts 5 dining options, a spa with organic treatments, and a golf course. Its spacious lofts feature elegant white and blue decor, extra-long beds, and private balconies with garden views. Guests can indulge in contemporary cuisine at the restaurant or enjoy drinks at the bar overlooking the pool.

sources.snippet: The Oitavos is a five-star luxury hotel sitting within the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park with a golf course considered the best in Portugal. Admire the rolling greens, rugged bush and sparkling Atlantic Ocean thanks to the all-glass design of the hotel. In addition to the superior and premium rooms, there are three styles of lofts, two suites and a private villa called The Forte.
sources.shortName: The Best Hotels In Cascais, Portugal, For Every Traveller

sources.snippet: A stunning, five-star hotel set amidst the rolling dune landscape of Cascais. The elegant and coastal cool suites offer spectacular views over this four-hundred-acre estate. Brimming with all the creature comforts of a top class hotel, it's perfect for a relaxing, romantic break.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Cascais, Portugal (2025)

places.name: The Oitavos

reviews.text:
I had an incredible experience staying at the Oitavos hotel! It was my first visit, and I thoroughly enjoyed every moment. The breakfast was outstanding, with a fantastic variety of high-quality options. The pool was lovely, and the spa facilities were exceptional, featuring a beautiful sauna where you could watch the sunset in the evenings. The gym was also well-equipped for a hotel gym.

However, the standout aspect of my stay was definitely the staff. Ricardo and Luis took care of us on several evenings and ensured our dining experience was nothing short of exceptional. They truly are a credit to the hotel and the main reason I'm giving this place a well-deserved 5-star rating!

Very spacious room but a bit cold in November. The bed is very comfortable and big. The design of the room is however not very good. There is no door between the bedroom and the bathroom/ toilet so it will be really awkward for friends or teenager siblings staying in the same room. The breakfast was really great. Many choices, especially the fruit bar was super nice. A lot of staff running around taking away your dish too soon.üòÜ

I recently stayed at this hotel and was extremely dissatisfied with our experience. It's hard to believe that this place is rated 5-stars given the significant lack of professionalism and organization.

1. Heating Problem in Our Room
On our first night, we felt cold but thought it might just be the change in climate. However, the real issue became evident when we returned from an event on the second day to find our room freezing, with the temperature only at 19¬∞C despite setting the thermostat. After waiting over two hours with no resolution after reporting the problem to reception, we were told the staff member who could help had an emergency. Not only was this shocking, but it was also unacceptable that we weren't informed about the delay or given the option to move rooms in a timely manner. Finally, the heating was fixed on our third day, which is simply not acceptable.

2. Confusion with Airport Transfer
We arranged for an early airport transfer through reception, and while the taxi arrived on time, the ordeal that followed was ridiculous. Upon arriving at the airport, the driver claimed the hotel would cover the fare. I received a message hours later insisting I needed to pay 70 euros because of a misunderstanding. This is absurd! I had not ordered the taxi and shouldn't be held responsible for the driver's assumptions. I even requested proof of the fare, yet the staff demanded payment before I could see a receipt. Although I eventually paid just to settle the matter, this entire situation was handled poorly and should never have happened.

Overall, I expected far more from a hotel of this caliber. I hope they take steps to improve their service and accountability in the future. My advice? Look elsewhere for your stay.
